business.headline: Olectra Greentech shares tumble nearly 7% in early trade. Here's whyThe stock, which has delivered over 2,250% returns in the last five years, has lost about a quarter of its value over the past year.

Sensex, Nifty fall sharply as markets break winning streak on profit bookingThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 707.85 points to 81,468.60, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 225.40 points to 24,775.75 as of 9:30 am.

Explained: Why NSE unlisted shares hit an all-time highThe latest rally in NSE's unlisted shares signals strong appetite in the grey market, where expectations are running high for bumper gains once the IPO finally materialises.

Borana Weaves IPO: Will it list at a premium? Here's what GMP suggestsBorana Weaves share price: The Borana Weaves IPO opened for subscription on May 20 and closed on May 22. It was subscribed 147.85 times in total.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty continue its bull run today?Investors are feeling more confident due to early monsoon rains and the Reserve Bank of India's dividend payout to the central government.

Stocks to watch on May 27: IndiGo, LIC, FirstCry, Borana Weaves, Tata MotorsThe shares of Borana Weaves will be listed on the stock exchanges today. The IPO received strong interest from investors during its subscription period.

India to become 4th largest economy by end of 2025: NITI Aayog memberIn April, the IMF had said that India is expected to be the fourth-largest economy in the world with a GDP of USD 4.19 trillion in 2025, ahead of Japan.

Rent vs buy? Why young Indians are rethinking homeownershipNot long ago, a house was more than just a home—it was a badge of honour in Indian families. Parents encouraged early buying, regardless of the financial strain. Today, however, younger Indians are rethinking this dream, looking for new paths to stability.

The billionaire blueprint: Inside DLF's ultra-luxury playbookWelcome to the new epicentre of ultra-luxury in India, where DLF isn't just selling apartments, it is curating a billionaire lifestyle and cashing in on the growing trend of 'living life king-size'.

Sensex ends 455 points higher, Nifty settles above 25,000; Eternal tanks 5%At the closing bell, the BSE Sensex was up 455.37 points to 82,176.45, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 148 points higher at 25,001.15. The broader markets also performed well during the session, extending the rally in mid-cap and small-cap stocks.

Is LTA exempt under the New Tax Regime? What you should knowLeave Travel Allowance (LTA) is a common perk in many salary packages, yet with two tax regimes in place, people often ask if the exemption holds true in the new tax regime. Let's find out in this article.

Supreme Court puts Bhushan Power liquidation on hold as JSW seeks reviewThis interim order effectively pauses the liquidation process of BSPL, offering JSW a window to pursue legal recourse and protect its investment interests.

entertainment.headline: Salman Khan issues warning about smoking, fake friends with Sohail's new clipActor Salman Khan issued a cautionary warning about smoking and fake friends on Instagram. He shared a clip of his brother Sohail Khan smoking in what appears to be his upcoming project.

Arjun Kapoor mentions 'selfish people' in cryptic note, says it's 'in our DNA'Actor Arjun Kapoor shared a note about 'selfish people' on his Instagram story. He wrote a few lines in his stories and referred to people who don't 'show up' in need.

Bhool Chuk Maaf box office Day 4: Impressive 1st Monday for Rajkummar Rao's filmRajkummar Rao's 'Bhool Chuk Maaf' has surprisingly performed decently well at the box office despite mixed reviews. The film has now passed its Monday test as well.

Actor Nani calls Tourist Family gem of a film, director says his praise unexpectedTelugu actor Nani appreciated the Tamil film, 'Tourist Family', calling it a 'gem'. 25-year-old director Abishan Jeevinth was over the moon seeing Nani's praise.

'Is this your feminism?' Director Sandeep Vanga accuses actor of leaking scriptFilmmaker Sandeep Reddy Vanga slammed the 'dirty PR games' of an unnamed actor in a cryptic post on X. It was rumoured that Deepika Padukone was considered to play the female lead in his upcoming film, 'Spirit'. Later, the makers officially announced that Triptii Dimri had been on board.

'Duck Dynasty' star Phil Robertson dies at  79Phil Robertson, founder of Duck Commander and star of Duck Dynasty, has died at 79. The family plans a private service and public memorial. His faith and legacy touched millions.

Shakira falls on stage in Montreal during 'Whenever, Wherever' performanceShakira slipped onstage during her Montreal concert while performing "Whenever, Wherever" but quickly recovered. Fans praised her resilience. The incident follows a prior tour delay due to a health scare in February.

2025 AMAs: Full performer lineup, nominees, and ticket infoThe 2025 AMAs air May 26 from Las Vegas, hosted by Jennifer Lopez. With major performances, big-name nominees, and honors for Janet Jackson and Rod Stewart, it promises a star-studded celebration.

Captain America: Brave new world streaming on Disney+ starting May 28Captain America: Brave New World begins streaming on Disney+ May 28. Already a box office success, the Marvel blockbuster stars Anthony Mackie and features a star-studded cast in key roles.

Saif Ali Khan, Deepika Padukone, Diana Penty's Cocktail set for re-release in May'Cocktail,' featuring Saif Ali Khan, Diana Penty and Deepika Padukone in lead roles, is all set to return to the big screens. The film is directed by Homi Adajania.

Jennifer Aniston's 'sunday photo dump' features Hindu Goddesses Lakshmi and Durga'FRIENDS' star Jennifer Aniston uploaded multiple pictures on Sunday, one of which has grabbed the attention of her fans in India. The particular picture features idols of Hindu Goddesses Lakshmi and Durga, next to an idol of Laughing Buddha.

Abhishek Banerjee's award-winning crime-drama Stolen to release in June 2025Actor Abhishek Banerjee's film 'Stolen' is all set to release on Prime Video, two years after its debut at the Venice Film Festival. Anurag Kashyap, Kiran Rao, Nikkhil Advani and Vikramaditya Motwane have executive produced the crime-thriller.

Naveen Polishetty's Anaganaga Oka Raju set for Sankranthi 2026 release After multiple delays, the makers of 'Anaganaga Oka Raju' finally confirmed its release for Sankranthi 2026. The family entertainer stars Naveen Polishetty and Meenakshi Chaudhary.

Dhadak 2 release date out: Siddhant-Triptii's film to hit cinemas in AugustAfter facing many delays, 'Dhadak 2', starring Siddhant Chaturvedi and Triptii Dimri, is set to hit theatres. The film will be released in August this year.

Actor Simbu on Manchu Manoj: He's like a small kid, show him love, not angerAt the pre-release event of Bhairavam, Manchu Manoj called his friend, actor Simbu, during a live segment, leading to a candid and cheerful exchange.

Allu Aravind extends support to Pawan Kalyan, distances from exhibitors strikePushpa star Allu Arjun's father and producer Allu Aravind addressed speculations regarding his involvement in the ongoing exhibitor's strike in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh.

Raveena Tandon on alleged feud with Karisma Kapoor: It was classroom politicsActor Raveena Tandon recently recalled her catfight with Karisma Kapoor in the 90s on film sets. In a conversation with Farah Khan on her Vlog, Raveena called it, 'classroom politics.'

Singer Demi Lovato marries Jordan Jutes in LA, wears Vivienne Westwood corset gownSinger and actor Demi Lovato on Sunday got married to her fiancé, Jordan Jutes Lutes, in California. The bride wore a custom Vivienne Westwood corset dress for the ceremony.

Actor Chhavi Mittal says Tahira Kashyap gave her 'confidence' during cancer battleActor Chhavi Mittal said that Tahira Kashyap was the first person she had a long conversation with during her breast cancer diagnosis. Chhavi shared how Tahira's advice gave her clarity.

general news.headline: Want to resolve all disputes: In Iran, Pak PM says ready to hold talks with IndiaDuring a visit to Tehran, Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif expressed willingness to hold peace talks with India to resolve key bilateral issues, including Kashmir, terrorism, water sharing, and trade.

H-1 B visa blamed as Walmart lays off 1,500, MAGA links it to Indian-origin CTOWalmart's decision to lay off over 1,500 employees in the US has triggered a backlash from the MAGA faithful, who claim the company is replacing American workers with foreign nationals on H-1B visas. Without a shred of evidence, the MAGA crowd is linking the move to a top Indian-origin executive at Walmart.

Video: Terrifying moment when car ploughed into Liverpool parade crowd, 50 injuredA speeding car drove into crowds celebrating Liverpool's Premier League win. A video has captured the moment of impact. The incident injured several people. A British man has been arrested.

Men without women forcing China to smuggle wives from Bangladesh, NepalChina's gender imbalance has birthed a shadow industry of bride-trafficking, where poor women from several Asian countries, including Bangladesh, Nepal and Myanmar, are lured with false promises and then "sold" as "wives" to rural Chinese men. These women, desperate for a better life, end up being confined, raped, and forced into childbirth.

Just joking around: Macron plays down viral video of wife shoving him on planeSpeaking to reporters after the clip went viral, Macron clarified that the exchange with his wife was being misunderstood and blamed disinformation efforts for distorting what he called a light-hearted moment.

Burdened by debt, 7 of Dehradun family die by suicide; bodies found in carAccording to sources, the family took this extreme step as they were in heavy debt and financial distress. Sources added that Praveen Mittal, a resident of Dehradun, had come to attend a spiritual event with his family at the Bageshwar Dham in Panchkula.

'Is this your feminism?' Director Sandeep Vanga accuses actor of leaking scriptFilmmaker Sandeep Reddy Vanga slammed the 'dirty PR games' of an unnamed actor in a cryptic post on X. It was rumoured that Deepika Padukone was considered to play the female lead in his upcoming film, 'Spirit'. Later, the makers officially announced that Triptii Dimri had been on board.

Nakal karne ke liye akal chahiye: Asaduddin Owaisi roasts Pak over fake photoAIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi mocked Pakistan for using a 2019 Chinese military drill photo as fake evidence of victory over India. He urged people not to trust Pakistan's claims.

Watch: Preity Zinta leads celebrations as Punjab end 11-year IPL playoffs droughtPunjab Kings co-owner Preity Zinta jumped in celebration after captain Shreyas Iyer sealed a seven-wicket win over Mumbai Indians with a match-winning six, securing PBKS's spot in Qualifier 1 of the IPL.

Amazon Fashion's 'SERVE' Store Offers Convenience, Selection and Value to Gen Z, says Nikhil Sinha, Director, Amazon FashionIndia's first dedicated Gen Z fashion store democratizes style access across the country with 3X customer growth

Sensex slumps nearly 800 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At 9:29 AM, the BSE Sensex was down 752 points at 81,424, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 209 points to 24,792. Broader market indices also faced selling pressure, with heightened volatility dragging down sentiment across the board.

Bengaluru sees wettest May in history, and month isn't even over yetBengaluru recorded its wettest May ever with 307.9 mm rainfall by May 26, surpassing the previous all-time high from 2023. As the southwest monsoon sets in across Karnataka, the rainfall may increase further.

Arjun Kapoor mentions 'selfish people' in cryptic note, says it's 'in our DNA'Actor Arjun Kapoor shared a note about 'selfish people' on his Instagram story. He wrote a few lines in his stories and referred to people who don't 'show up' in need.

Got perks, VIP access: Digital evidence shows Jyoti Malhotra tied to 4 PakistanisHisar police uncovered 12TB of digital forensic data in the probe, revealing alarming details about YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra's communications, special visa approvals and her role in a narrative push linked to Pakistan's ISI.

'Pak spy' CRPF jawan's Pahalgam posting ended 6 days before terror attackMoti Ram Jat was actively involved in espionage activity and had been sharing classified information related to national security with Pakistani intelligence officers (PIOs) since 2023.

Need to throttle them: Putin hits out at Microsoft, Zoom over 'anti-state' actsRussian President Vladimir Putin said Microsoft, Zoom and other foreign tech firms should be "throttled" in Russia for undermining national sovereignty, urging domestic software growth amid rising global backlash over Ukraine.
Taking a shower twice a day, but still breaking out? What you might be missingSweaty summer days often lead to more shower time. But there is a catch when it comes to frequent rinse and repeat.

Three service chiefs monitored Op Sindoor in real-time, show new picsThe Indian Army released a detailed booklet on Operation Sindoor, showcasing the command centre and leadership during precision strikes on terror infrastructure across Pakistan and POK.

D Gukesh loses to Magnus Carlsen in thriller Norway Chess openerNorway Chess 2025: World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen defeated world champion D Gukesh in a thrilling opening-round game on Monday. Arjun Erigaisi, meanwhile, began his campaign with a win.

Expelled from RJD, what's next for Tej Pratap Yadav? He formed outfits earlierTej Pratap Yadav, who was expelled from the RJD after a row over a now-deleted X post claiming his '12-year-old relationship' with a woman, has a number of options. He could either float a new party or outfit or form an alliance with a party.

Push-ins from India unacceptable, ready to step in if needed: Bangladesh ArmyA top officer of the Bangladesh Army termed India's handing over of Bangladeshi illegal immigrants a "push in" and said it was "unacceptable". Brigadier General Md Nazim-ud-Daula said the army was ready to step in if needed and instructed by the government. India has been handing over Bangladeshi illegal immigrants to Border Guard Bangladesh personnel.

1 run, 1 wide, 10 wickets: UK club cricket team, chasing 427, folds for 2 runsRichmond's Fourth XI suffered a record-breaking collapse, bowled out for just two runs — one from the bat and one wide — chasing 427 in a Middlesex League match against North London CC.

J&K cop threatens suicide over salary, climbs tree, rescued by MLA after 5 hoursAn MLA from Jammu and Kashmir had to be called in to rescue an SPO from J&K Police, who climbed a tree in Himachal Pradesh's Dalhousie for nearly five hours and threatened to kill himself over a cut in his salary.

Consensual relationship turning sour...: Top court cancels rape case against manThe Supreme Court cancelled a rape case against a 25-year-old man, stressing that a consensual relationship turning sour or partners becoming distant cannot be grounds for invoking the criminal machinery.

sports.headline: PBKS manifested, believed and worked hard for top two finish: Shashank SinghPunjab Kings' (PBKS) batter Shashank Singh revealed that their team manifested a top two finish right after the auction and worked hard towards it. Punjab qualified for the IPL playoffs after 11 years and guaranteed a top-two finish, following their 7-wicket win over Mumbai Indians (MI) in their last fixture in Jaipur.

Told Priyansh Arya would be the find of IPL 2025, hard to argue now: PontingIPL 2025: Priyansh Arya delivered a match-winning knock against Mumbai Indians, validating Ricky Ponting's early-season prediction of him being a breakout star. The young batter's consistency and composure have been key to Punjab Kings securing a top-two finish in IPL 2025.

PBKS loss not the end of the world, we'll bounce back in Eliminator: Ryan RickeltonMumbai Indians' wicketkeeper batter Ryan Rickelton said that the team isn't too worried about their loss against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their last fixture and backed them to bounce back strongly in the Eliminator. PBKS beat MI by seven wickets in their last league fixture in Jaipur.

French Open 2025, Day 3 Order of Play: Djokovic, Zverev and Gauff begin campaignDay 3 at the Roland Garros 2025 will feature several big names starting their campaign as Novak Djokovic, Alexander Zverev, Coco Gauff and Jessica Pegula, amongst others will begin their campaign.

Mumbai Indians got outplayed by Punjab Kings, fell 20 runs short: Ryan RickeltonMumbai Indians' (MI) wicketkeeper batter Ryan Rickelton rued his team's batting performance after their seven-wicket hammering against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in Match 69 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Won't be easy for Virat, Rohit to maintain fitness for ODIs: Anil KumbleLegendary spinner Anil Kumble said that while it won't be easy for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma—who will continue playing ODI cricket—to maintain their fitness levels, the two stalwarts should be celebrated for the remainder of their careers.

Shashank Singh reacts to viral podcast clip after PBKS seal top 2 spot in IPL 2025PBKS vs MI: Punjab Kings secured a top-two finish in IPL 2025, fulfilling Shashank Singh's pre-season prediction and earning a spot in Qualifier 1. He credited the team's success to the strong culture and unity fostered by captain Shreyas Iyer and coach Ricky Ponting.

Cristiano Ronaldo hints at Al Nassr exit amid Club World Cup speculationLegendary forward Cristiano Ronaldo hinted at the end of his tenure with Saudi Pro League club Al Nassr. In a cryptic social media post, Ronaldo said "this chapter is over" hours after Al Nassr's final league game of the 2024-25 season.

Jannik Sinner off to winning start at French Open, joins Nadal in elite listJannik Sinner extended his Grand Slam winning streak to 15 with a straight-sets win at French Open. Sinner joined Rafael Nadal, Roger Federer, Novak Djokovic and Carlos Alcaraz in an elite list.

In a cryptic social media post, Ronaldo said "this chapter is over" hours after Al Nassr's final league game of the 2024-25 season.

Akash Deep blames pacers' injuries for LSG's failure to reach playoffsLucknow Super Giants pacer Akash Deep said that all four of LSG's main fast bowlers were sidelined before the tournament started, which affected the team's rhythm and bowling strength. LSG were marred by injuries ahead of IPL 2025, with the four main pacers, Mayank Yadav, Avesh Khan, Mohsin Khan, and Akash Deep, all unavailable for the first few games.

RCB spin bowling coach slams IPL title drought talks ahead of LSG clashRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) spin bowling coach Malolan Rangarajan has dismissed criticism over the franchise's title drought and comparisons with England's underperforming men's football team. Speaking ahead of RCB's final IPL 2025 group match against Lucknow Super Giants, Rangarajan insisted that the team's past doesn't weigh on the current squad, which he believes is far more balanced and focused than previous line-ups.

Watch: Preity Zinta leads celebrations as Punjab end 11-year IPL playoffs droughtPunjab Kings co-owner Preity Zinta jumped in celebration after captain Shreyas Iyer sealed a seven-wicket win over Mumbai Indians with a match-winning six, securing PBKS's spot in Qualifier 1 of the IPL.

Shreyas Iyer explains secret to Punjab's success, reveals Ricky Ponting camaraderieShreyas Iyer revealed the secret behind Punjab Kings' success this season and opened up on his bond with Ricky Ponting. PBKS secured a top-two finish for the first time in 11 years as they beat MI in Jaipur on Monday, May 26.

PBKS vs MI: Punjab secure top two spot after 11 years, send Mumbai to EliminatorJosh Inglis and Priyansh Arya were the stars of the show as Punjab Kings secured their first top-two finish in 11 years in Jaipur on Monday, May 26. This meant that MI will play in the Eliminator of IPL 2025.

My Roland Garros record may fall, but it will take at least 30 years: Rafael NadalFrench Open 2025: Speaking after receiving a glorious tribute at Roland Garros on Sunday, legendary Rafael Nadal said it will need at least three decades for anyone to emulate his record of 14 titles.

Suryakumar Yadav breaks Sachin Tendulkar's Mumbai Indians record in IPLSuryakumar Yadav has gone past Sachin Tendulkar's long-standing record for the most runs scored by a Mumbai Indians batter in a single season of the Indian Premier League.

A friendly text? Andy Murray's message to Rafael Nadal was a cheeky Arsenal jabRafael Nadal revealed the fun banter he had with Andy Murray after Arsenal defeated Real Madrid in the Champions League quarterfinals this season. Nadal revealed it during the press conference after his tribute at Roland Garros.

Upset in Round 1 as 4th seed Fritz ousted, Badosa knocks out OsakaFrench Open 2025: Fourth seed Taylor Fritz crashed out in the first round after losing in four sets to World No. 66 Daniel Altmaier. Meanwhile, Naomi Osaka lost her women's singles first-round match to 10th seed Paula Badosa on Monday.

How Rafael Nadal's footprint inspired Paula Badosa in comeback win vs Naomi OsakaFrench Open 2025: World No.1 Paula Badosa drew inspiration from Rafael Nadal's bronze footprint on Court Philippe-Chatrier to secure a hard-fought win over Naomi Osaka in the first round of the Roland Garros.

Happy with Josh Hazlewood return, but RCB have a quality squad: Assistant coachRCB assistant coach Malolan Rangarajan has said that while the team is happy to see Josh Hazlewood return in time for the playoffs, they have enough talent in the squad this time around to make up for then absence of the Australian pacer.

England vs India Tests: Live streaming on JioStar, Sony to telecast seriesJioStar and Sony Pictures Networks India will jointly broadcast India's 2025–26 tours of England, with JioHotstar streaming matches and Sony airing them on TV. The partnership includes a five-Test series and a 2026 white-ball tour.

No pep talk for PBKS: Shreyas Iyer says he lets actions speak more than wordsShreyas Iyer opened up about his captaincy and said that he is a skipper who lets his actions do the talking on the field. Shreyas has been sensational as a captain this season for the Punjab Kings in IPL 2025.

Carlos Alcaraz begins title defence in style, Emma Raducanu wriggles out of dangerFrench Open 2025: Carlos Alcaraz began his Roland Garros title defence with a commanding straight sets win. Emma Raducanu fought hard to reach the second round, setting up a tough clash against Iga Swiatek.

Sai Sudharsan's technique against moving ball needs to improve: EX-TN coachFormer Tamil Nadu coach Sulakshan Kulkarni has said that Sai Sudharsan's technique needs to improve against the moving ball ahead of the England tour. Sudharsan is one of the new faces in the India squad for the tour.

Priyank Panchal retires, recalls late father's motivation in emotional noteVeteran Gujarat opener Priyank Panchal has announced his retirement from all formats of cricket with immediate effect. Panchal recalled his late father's motivational message in an emotional farewell note.

Aakash Chopra reveals his top two teams and finalists of IPL 2025Former India cricketer-turned commentator Aakash Chopra has predicted his top two teams and the finalists of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Alonso thanks Carlo Ancelloti, hopes to make Real Madrid unstoppable forceXabi Alonso has promised to help Real Madrid achieve great things after being unveiled as the club's new manager on Monday. Alonso also thanked Carlo Ancelotti, saying he wouldn't be in this position without his predecessor's influence.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
